text: RT @EnvAgencyMids: There will be a release of water from Ladybower Reservoir #Derbyshire today (Tuesday) from 8am to increase flood storage…

@YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets Approx 25yrs ago all the rivers/canals were constantly dredged and the gunge was put up on the banks to build them up higher. This year I noticed the same canal was down to about 4’ deep from around 9’. It’s not rocket science dredge rivers onto banks stop flooding
RT @EnvAgencyMids: There will be a release of water from Ladybower Reservoir #Derbyshire today (Tuesday) from 8am to increase flood storage…

A quick update from the #AireAndCalder Canal Breach.

Yesterday the @EnvAgencyYNE have assisted partners with #mapping, #drones & #UltraHighVolumePumps.

These pumps are pretty complex to install, each section of pipe weighs 75kg & we’ve got 150m of pipe deployed! https://t.co/PkCmvUZ5L2

text: @caballosblancos @EnvAgency FFS
RT @DevonWildlife: 💧🐟Did you know that small water bodies make up 80% of England's freshwaters and support over 70% of our freshwater speci…

@bentheoandrews @frankt3323 @TheMontyDon @NFUtweets @EnvAgency Yes I know what it's like as well, I had over a metre of water in my house when I was in Yorkshire 20 years ago. It's horrible.
That's why I get so infuriated with people like #FarmerPrice who take the law into their own hands and just make things worse.
@puncherton @bentheoandrews @TheMontyDon @NFUtweets @EnvAgency No, people just referring to what is a general problem in the Wye/Lugg and its tribs at the moment.
@bentheoandrews @puncherton @TheMontyDon @NFUtweets @EnvAgency Yes and it takes huge amounts of time to re-create.
@puncherton @bentheoandrews @TheMontyDon @NFUtweets @EnvAgency Not sure what you mean.

@IvorWilde @bentheoandrews @TheMontyDon @Kenarf @MerryAlbright @NFUtweets @EnvAgency Yes both are problematic crops. We don't have any sugar beet in this part of the world but loads of maize which is often a real problem.

text:
RT @BrunelFlood_Eng: Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one…

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/eoS7vp3PaI

urls.title: Flood and Coastal Engineering | Brunel University London
urls.description: This exciting new funded programme, developed in partnership with the Environment Agency will equip you with the knowledge you need for a successful career in flood risk management.
